resource.name: Metro Energy Use Index Benchmarking, 2021
resource.description: EUI (Energy Use Index) values for Metro Nashville Government facilities for Calendar Year 2021. EUI is an indicator of the amount of energy consumed on a property annually, in relation to the size of the building. It is a metric that is used to indicate if a building is energy efficient.
columns_description: Total amount of energy consumed from all energy sources for a property in a given year (expressed in kBTU)
Total amount of natural gas costs for a property in a given year
Total amount of energy consumption costs from all energy sources for a property in a given year
Total amount of district steam costs for a property in a given year
Total amount of district chilled water costs for a property in a given year
Total amount of electricity costs for a property in a given year
Energy Use Index - measure of energy use (expressed in kBTU units) per square foot in a calendar year
US Department of Energy national EUI benchmarks for specific property types and categories
Name of the facility, building, or site
Energy Cost Index - measure of all energy costs per square foot in a calendar year
Total amount of district steam consumed for a property in a given year (expressed in lbs)
Total amount of district chilled water consumed for a property in a given year (expressed in ton-hours)
Reported size of the property
Broad category of the property type that highlights the intended use of the property, based on terms defined by EnergyStar, US Department of Energy
Street address of the property
Metro department the facility belongs to
Property type that best matches the intended use of the property, based on terms defined by EnergyStar, US Department of Energy
Total amount of electricity consumed for a property in a given year (expressed in kWh)
Total amount of natural gas consumed for a property in a given year (expressed in therms)

resource.name: Schedule of State Grant Awards, 2015-Present
resource.description:
The dataset is a summary of the state grant awards for all Metro departments.  The detail is provided annually by each department in an excel format and then reviewed and summarized by the Finance Department.  The excel file is provided to Metro’s external auditors and is the source of Metro’s Single Audit report which is published annually and available on Metro’s website in a pdf format.
The detail included in this dataset includes fiscal year, program title, contract number, grant period, program award, (accrued) deferred grant revenue balance at the beginning of the fiscal year, amount of state grant money received, revenue adjustments made if any, expenditures/distributions made, expenditure/payment adjustments made if any, (accrued) deferred grant revenue balance at the end of the fiscal year, grantor name, department code, and department full name.
columns_description: Abbreviation of the department that received the grant award.
The name of the grant award.
Fiscal year applicable to the data.
Department name that received the grant award.
The contract number for the grant award.
The date range for the period of the grant award.
The total amount of grant award expenditures or distributions during the fiscal year.
The name of the state grantor.

resource.name: Schedule of Federal Grant Awards, 2015-Present
resource.description:
The dataset is a summary of the federal grant awards for all Metro departments.  The detail is provided annually by each department in an excel format and then reviewed and summarized by the Finance Department.  The excel file is provided to Metro’s external auditors and is the source of Metro’s Single Audit report which is published annually and available on Metro’s website in a pdf format.
The detail included in this dataset includes fiscal year, program title, federal CFDA number, contract number, grant period, program award, (accrued) deferred grant revenue balance at the beginning of the fiscal year, amount of federal grant money received, revenue adjustments made if any, expenditures/distributions made, expenditure/payment adjustments made if any, (accrued) deferred grant revenue balance at the end of the fiscal year, amounts given to subrecipients, grantor name, pass through grantor name, department code, and department full name.
columns_name: Contract Number/Pass Through Entity Identifying Number
columns_description: Department name that received the grant award.

The total amount of grant award expenditures or distributions during the fiscal year.
Fiscal year applicable to the data.
The contract number for the grant award.
Abbreviation of the department that received the grant award.
The name of the federal grantor.
The amount of grant award passed through to sub-recipients.

resource.name: Sidewalk Inventory for ADA Self-Assessment
resource.description: Granular inventory points on the Metro Nashville public sidewalk network that describe defects, obstructions, or other relevant items that may affect ADA compliance of the pedestrian route.
columns_description: The name of the street that the sidewalk route begins (intersects at the starting point)
Side of the street (ONST) that the sidewalk route is located on
The WGS 84 Longitude of the location of the event/observation in decimal degrees
This is the unique route identifier of the sidewalk section.  It is described by the ONST, FROMST, TOST, Side fields that follow
The type of event/observation along the sidewalk route
A more detailed description of the object identified in the EVNT_TYPE observation
The WGS 84 Latitude of the location of the event/observation in decimal degrees
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, this field describes the material of which the sidewalk is constructed.
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, this field describes the width of the sidewalk furnishing zone in feet.
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, , this field describes the cross slope in percent grade of the sidewalk at the given measure
For POLES, BOXES, STORMGRATES, this field describes the resulting path of travel of the sidewalk taking into account the obstruction.
In cases of overhead obstructions of the path of travel, this field describes the resulting path of travel taking into account the obstruction
Combined latitude and longitude of event/observation for mapping purposes
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, this field describes the width of the sidewalk in feet.
When the EVNT_TYPE=DRIVEWAY, this field describes the construction of the driveway where it ties into the sidewalk path of travel.
Indicates if the section of sidewalk has been repaired  and made ADA compliant subsequent to the collection of the observation
When the EVNT_TYPE=DRIVEWAY, this field describes the direction of the cross- slope downslope (TOROAD=Toward the public roadway; AWROAD=Away from the public roadway
The name of the street that the sidewalk route follows along (parallel to)
The name of the street that the sidewalk route ends (intersects at the ending point)
The distance along the sidewalk route from the starting point of the route to the event/observation described.
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, this field describes the type of curb (if any) adjacent to the sidewalk route
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIUTE, this field describes the direction of the cross-slope downslope
When the EVNT_TYPE=DRIVEWAY, this field describes if the sidewalk has a laydown to the driveway grade (Yes or No).

Because observation may be linear, the EVENT_SUBT will describe if the specific observation is a point only, or the beginning or ending of a linear event.  Some event types are inferred to be points and thus this field may not be populated for many events.  This field also identifies if STORMGRATES in the roadway are Bike friendly or not.
When the EVNT_TYPE=DRIVEWAY, this field describes the cross slope in percent grade of the sidewalk at the centerline of the driveway alignment at the intersection of the sidewalk path of travel.
